alert.note: Alert for Morris; Pottawatomie; Riley; Shawnee; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 04 at 10:36PM CDT until July 05 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1100 PM CDT FOR DICKINSON...GEARY...SOUTHERN RILEY...MORRIS...NORTHWESTERN SHAWNEE...WABAUNSEE...SOUTHERN POTTAWATOMIE AND NORTHWESTERN LYON COUNTIES... At 1035 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Wamego to 4 miles northwest of Alta Vista to near Ramona, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Northwestern Topeka, Manhattan, Junction City, Abilene, Wamego, Herington, Council Grove, Rossville, Alma, Eskridge, St. Marys, Ogden, Grandview Plaza, Dover, Silver Lake, Chapman, Enterprise, St. George, Maple Hill and White City. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 277 and 355. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
